summary: This is an email chain from May 27, 2008, discussing Jeffrey Epstein's potential plea deal, with one sender expressing sarcastic outrage at the possibility of Epstein receiving only 90 days in jail. The email appears to be internal communication among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel.

persons.name: Barry
persons.context: Mentioned as having talked to someone about Epstein's case, relaying information about a potential 90-day jail sentence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email discussion regarding a potential plea deal that might involve only 90 days in jail.

connections.description: Barry is discussing Epstein's case and potential plea deal with others in the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Discussion of Epstein's potential plea deal
events.description: Internal email discussion among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel about Epstein possibly receiving only 90 days in jail as part of a plea deal.

keyFacts: Internal U.S. Attorney's Office emails from May 2008 discuss Jeffrey Epstein's potential plea deal.
One email expresses sarcastic outrage at the possibility of Epstein receiving only 90 days in jail.
The email suggests prosecutors were aware of and discussing what would become Epstein's controversial non-prosecution agreement.
The correspondence reveals internal skepticism or criticism about the leniency of Epstein's potential sentence.
